div.p: Click Here for updates on COVID-19 and Kenedy ISD

div.div: We appreciate all the patience and support we have received from our community during this challenging time. KISD remains committed to providing a safe learning and working environment for our students and staff. In doing our part to stop the spread of COVID-19, Kenedy ISD schools will remain closed through April 24. (Read More)
Please follow these instructions if you are having issues visiting sites on your Kenedy ISD Chromebook.

KISD has made it our number one priority to keep our students and families safe during the COVID-19 crisis. We continue to balance that priority with continuing to educate and feed students. With today's announcement that Karnes County does have a confirmed case of COVID and the announcement made by Mayor Ron Nirenberg of San Antonio to "stay at home", we have carefully reevaluated our operations and are taking immediate action to scale down staff that reports physically to work. (Read More)

img.title: KHS Senior Receives Appointment To USAFA

a.title: KHS Senior Receives Appointment To USAFA
a.h3: KHS Senior Receives Appointment To USAFA

div.div: On Monday, April 22, 2020, the Board of Trustees of Kenedy ISD-Karnes County will reconvene in a special meeting beginning at 6:00 p.m. via phone conference. For the agenda and notice with instructions on joining the call, please visit the Board of Trustees link

Kenedy ISD has closely followed the reports and information shared by our local health department, the Texas Department of State Health Services (DSHS), and the Centers for Disease Control and Prevention (CDC) regarding Coronavirus (COVID-19). While no cases have been confirmed in our community, we will continue to monitor the situation and will provide information as it becomes available from the public health authorities. Public health officials consider the risk to our school community is low at this time. (Please Read More)

div.h2: Welcome to Kenedy Independent School District

div.style: color: rgb(68, 68, 68); font-family: "Open Sans", sans-serif; font-size: 14px; text-align: left;

img.title: KENEDY ISD
img.style: width: 577px; height: 308px; vertical-align: middle; margin: 10px; text-align: center;

br.br: The mission of Kenedy ISD is to inspire, prepare and educate students by personalizing the learning experience in order to achieve each student's vision for the future. Together as a team of students, parents, staff and community this mission is accomplished.

div.style: color: rgb(68, 68, 68); font-family: "Open Sans", sans-serif; font-size: 14px;
color: rgb(68, 68, 68); font-family: "Open Sans", sans-serif; font-size: 14px;
color: rgb(68, 68, 68); font-family: "Open Sans", sans-serif; font-size: 14px;
div.span: KISD promotes success in the classroom on the "playing field", and at home. Students, parents, staff, and community members collaborate to create a safe learning environment. Supported by relevant, state of the art resources and technology, we are a high performing district of choice. By implementing modern concepts of learning, KISD provides a place where our students' dreams become realities.

br.br:
Hello! It gives me great pleasure to serve as the Superintendent of Schools for Kenedy ISD. I bring administrative experience at the Central Office level from two school districts. In Somerset ISD, I served as Executive Director of Elementary Curriculum, overseeing various grants and programs, and supporting the leadership, curriculum and instruction at the elementary campuses. I am most proud of my work with the Gifted and Talented program, Bilingual/ESL program and Response to Intervention program, and working with colleagues to develop processes and procedures to standardize expectations and improve student outcomes. I had the good fortune to learn from amazing leaders, both formal and informal, and plan to implement this learning with my new family at Kenedy ISD. Before my work at central office, I worked as a campus principal for ten years, an assistant principal for three years, and I spent eleven years teaching elementary students.
READ MORE HERE
